[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I feel so grateful to have a boss who is always so supportive of me.
That's amazing to hear. Having a supportive boss can make all the difference in how you feel about your job.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Creative Hobby and Personal Growth', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A shares their creativity in making earrings, reflecting on personal growth and overcoming past actions with Co-workers B.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, look at these earrings I made! I used wire to create these cool spiral designs. ### Co-workers B: Those are amazing! You're so creative, Co-worker A. ### Co-workers A: Thanks, Co-worker B. I've been really into making jewelry lately. It's a fun hobby. ### Co-workers B: I remember when we first met on that movie set. You were so focused on your acting, I never would've guessed you had a talent for jewelry making too. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, I guess I surprise people sometimes. I remember when we talked about that time I blew up that rabbit with dynamite. It still makes me so angry when I think about it. ### Co-workers B: I know, it's understandable. That was a really terrible thing for those boys to do. But you know what? You've come a long way since then. You've grown as a person and as an artist. ### Co-workers A: Thanks, Co-worker B. I've definitely learned a lot about empathy and compassion since then. Like that time when I was a kid and I freaked out over a spider. I can look back now and see how silly it was, but at the time it felt very real to me. ### Co-workers B: I think a lot of people can relate to that. We all have our fears and anxieties. But you've shown that you can overcome those things. And now you're making these beautiful earrings! ### Co-workers A: Ha, yeah. It's funny how life works sometimes. You never know where it's going to take you. But I'm grateful for all the experiences that have led me here. ### Co-workers B: Me too, Co-worker A. And I can't wait to see what you create next. Who knows? Maybe you'll end up designing jewelry for a movie someday!' }
```
